001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
005import java.lang.StackWalker.StackFrame;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.time.Instant;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.function.Supplier;
011
012import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
013
014import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues.MutableKeyValues;
015import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Builder;
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.CallerInfo;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Router;
018
019/**
020 * A LogEvent is a container for a single call to a logger. An event should not created
021 * unless a route or logger is actually enabled.
022 *
023 * @author agentgt
024 * @apiNote LogEvent is currently sealed
025 * @see LogMessageFormatter
026 */
027public sealed interface LogEvent {
028
029        /**
030         * Creates a log event.
031         * @param level the logging level.
032         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
033         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
034         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
035         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
036         * @return event
037         * @see LevelResolver
038         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
039         */
040        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
041                        KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
042                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
043                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
044                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
045                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
046
047                return new DefaultLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
048                                throwable);
049
050        }
051
052        /**
053         * Creates a log event.
054         * @param level the logging level.
055         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
056         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
057         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
058         * @return event
059         * @see LevelResolver
060         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
061         */
062        static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
063                        @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
064                return of(level, loggerName, formattedMessage, KeyValues.of(), throwable);
065        }
066
067        /**
068         * Creates a log event.
069         * @param level the logging level.
070         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
071         * @param message the unformatted message.
072         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
073         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
074         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
075         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
076         * @return event
077         * @see LevelResolver
078         * @see LogMessageFormatter
079         */
080        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
081                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1) {
082                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
083                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
084                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
085                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
086                return new OneArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
087                                messageFormatter, null, arg1);
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * Creates a log event.
092         * @param level the logging level.
093         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
094         * @param message the unformatted message.
095         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
096         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
097         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
098         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
099         * @param arg2 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
100         * @return event
101         * @see LevelResolver
102         * @see LogMessageFormatter
103         */
104        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
105                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
106                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
107                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
108                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
109                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
110                return new TwoArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
111                                messageFormatter, null, arg1, arg2);
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Creates a log event.
116         * @param level the logging level.
117         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
118         * @param message the unformatted message.
119         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
120         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
121         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
122         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
123         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
124         * @return event
125         * @see LevelResolver
126         * @see LogMessageFormatter
127         */
128        public static LogEvent ofArgs(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
129                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object[] args) {
130                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
131                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
132                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
133                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
134                return new ArrayArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
135                                messageFormatter, null, args);
136        }
137
138        /**
139         * Creates a new event with the caller info attached. <em> This method always returns
140         * a new event does not check if the original has caller info. </em>
141         * @param event original event.
142         * @param caller caller info.
143         * @return new log event.
144         */
145        public static LogEvent withCaller(LogEvent event, CallerInfo caller) {
146                return new StackFrameLogEvent(event, caller);
147        }
148
149        /**
150         * Timestamp when the event was created.
151         * @return instant when the event was created.
152         */
153        public Instant timestamp();
154
155        /**
156         * Name of the thread.
157         * @return thread name.
158         * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
159         */
160        public String threadName();
161
162        /**
163         * Thread id.
164         * @return thread id.
165         */
166        public long threadId();
167
168        /**
169         * The logging level. {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#ALL} and
170         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#OFF} should not be returned as they have
171         * special meaning.
172         * @return level.
173         */
174        public System.Logger.Level level();
175
176        /**
177         * Name of logger.
178         * @return name of logger.
179         */
180        public String loggerName();
181
182        /**
183         * Unformatted message.
184         * @return unformatted message
185         * @see #formattedMessage(StringBuilder)
186         */
187        public String message();
188
189        /**
190         * Appends the formatted message.
191         * @param sb string builder to use.
192         * @see LogMessageFormatter
193         */
194        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb);
195
196        /**
197         * Appends the formatted message.
198         * @param a appendable to append to.
199         * @see LogMessageFormatter
200         * @throws UncheckedIOException if an IOException is thrown by the appendable.
201         */
202        default void formattedMessage(Appendable a) {
203                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
204                formattedMessage(sb);
205                try {
206                        a.append(sb);
207                }
208                catch (IOException e) {
209                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
210                }
211        }
212
213        /**
214         * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
215         * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be returned.
216         */
217        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull();
218
219        /**
220         * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
221         * @return key values.
222         */
223        public KeyValues keyValues();
224
225        /**
226         * Returns info about caller or <code>null</code> if not supported.
227         * @return caller info
228         */
229        default @Nullable CallerInfo callerOrNull() {
230                return null;
231        }
232
233        /**
234         * Freeze will return a LogEvent that is safe to use in a different thread. Usually
235         * this entails copying the data or checking if it is already immutable. Freeze should
236         * be called before passing an event to an {@link LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher}.
237         * @return thread safe log event.
238         */
239        public LogEvent freeze();
240
241        /**
242         * Freeze and replace with the given timestamp.
243         * @param timestamp instant to replace timestamp in this.
244         * @return a copy of this with the given timestamp.
245         */
246        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp);
247
248        /**
249         * A builder to create events by calling {@link Router#eventBuilder(String, Level)}.
250         * <strong>{@link #log()}</strong> should be called at the very end otherwise the
251         * event will not be logged. <strong> Because of potential future optimizations (see
252         * API note) It is best to assume this builder returns a different builder on every
253         * setter call even if it may not currently! </strong>
254         *
255         * @apiNote unless the builder gets marked for escape analysis the static
256         * {@link LogEvent} factory methods are more likely to be superior in performance. EA
257         * is tricky business and often requires the object be small enough and should not
258         * leave the method it is constructed in but the JDK is continuously getting better
259         * optimizing immutable objects. Thus it is best to assume this builder will return a
260         * different builder on every call.
261         */
262        public sealed interface Builder {
263
264                /**
265                 * Timestamp when the event was created.
266                 * @param timestamp time the event happened.
267                 * @return this.
268                 */
269                public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp);
270
271                /**
272                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
273                 * @param argSupplier supplier will be called immediatly if this event is to be
274                 * logged.
275                 * @return this.
276                 */
277                Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier);
278
279                /**
280                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
281                 * @param arg maybe null.
282                 * @return this.
283                 */
284                Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg);
285
286                /**
287                 * Sets the message formatter which interpolates argument place holders.
288                 * @param messageFormatter formatter if not set
289                 * {@link LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter#SLF4J} will be used.
290                 * @return this.
291                 */
292                public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter);
293
294                /**
295                 * Name of the thread.
296                 * @param threadName name of thread.
297                 * @return this.
298                 * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
299                 */
300                public Builder threadName(String threadName);
301
302                /**
303                 * Thread id.
304                 * @param threadId {@link Thread#getId()}.
305                 * @return this.
306                 */
307                public Builder threadId(long threadId);
308
309                /**
310                 * Unformatted message.
311                 * @param message unformatted message.
312                 * @return unformatted message
313                 */
314                public Builder message(String message);
315
316                /**
317                 * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
318                 * @param throwable exception at the time of the event.
319                 * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be
320                 * returned.
321                 */
322                public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable);
323
324                /**
325                 * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
326                 * @param keyValues will use the passed in keyvalues for the event.
327                 * @return key values.
328                 */
329                public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues);
330
331                /**
332                 * Will log the event with the current values.
333                 * @return true if accepted.
334                 */
335                public boolean log();
336
337                /**
338                 * Will generate the event if the router can accept otherwise <code>null</code>.
339                 * @return event or <code>null</code>.
340                 * @apiNote The event is not logged but just created if possible if logging is
341                 * desired use {@link #log()} or check if the return is not <code>null</code> and
342                 * then log.
343                 */
344                public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull();
345
346        }
347
348        /**
349         * Caller info usually derived from Stack walking.
350         */
351        public sealed interface CallerInfo {
352
353                /**
354                 * Creates caller info from a stack frame.
355                 * @param stackFrame stack frame must have
356                 * {@link java.lang.StackWalker.Option#RETAIN_CLASS_REFERENCE}.
357                 * @return caller info.
358                 */
359                public static CallerInfo of(StackFrame stackFrame) {
360                        return new StackFrameCallerInfo(stackFrame);
361                }
362
363                /**
364                 * See {@link StackFrame#getClassName()}.
365                 * @return class name.
366                 */
367                public String getClassName();
368
369                /**
370                 * See {@link StackFrame#getFileName()}.
371                 * @return file name.
372                 */
373                public String getFileName();
374
375                /**
376                 * See {@link StackFrame#getLineNumber()}.
377                 * @return line number.
378                 */
379                public int getLineNumber();
380
381                /**
382                 * See {@link StackFrame#getMethodName()}.
383                 * @return method name.
384                 */
385                public String getMethodName();
386
387                /**
388                 * Make the caller info immutable.
389                 * @return immutable caller info and if this is already immutable return this.
390                 */
391                public CallerInfo freeze();
392
393        }
394
395}
396
397record FrozenCallerInfo(String getClassName, String getFileName, int getLineNumber,
398                String getMethodName) implements LogEvent.CallerInfo {
399        @Override
400        public CallerInfo freeze() {
401                return this;
402        }
403}
404
405record StackFrameCallerInfo(StackFrame stackFrame) implements LogEvent.CallerInfo {
406
407        @Override
408        public String getClassName() {
409                return stackFrame.getClassName();
410        }
411
412        @Override
413        public String getFileName() {
414                return stackFrame.getFileName();
415        }
416
417        @Override
418        public int getLineNumber() {
419                return stackFrame.getLineNumber();
420        }
421
422        @Override
423        public String getMethodName() {
424                return stackFrame.getMethodName();
425        }
426
427        @Override
428        public CallerInfo freeze() {
429                return new FrozenCallerInfo(getClassName(), getFileName(), getLineNumber(), getMethodName());
430        }
431
432}
433
434final class LogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
435
436        private final LogEventLogger logger;
437
438        private final Level level;
439
440        private final String loggerName;
441
442        private Instant timestamp = Instant.now();
443
444        private String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
445
446        private long threadId = Thread.currentThread().threadId();
447
448        private String message = "";
449
450        private @Nullable Throwable throwable;
451
452        private KeyValues keyValues = KeyValues.of();
453
454        private @Nullable List<@Nullable Object> args = null;
455
456        private LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter = LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter.SLF4J;
457
458        LogEventBuilder(LogEventLogger logger, Level level, String loggerName) {
459                super();
460                this.logger = logger;
461                this.level = level;
462                this.loggerName = loggerName;
463        }
464
465        @Override
466        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
467                this.timestamp = timestamp;
468                return this;
469        }
470
471        @Override
472        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
473                this.threadName = threadName;
474                return this;
475        }
476
477        @Override
478        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
479                this.threadId = threadId;
480                return this;
481        }
482
483        @Override
484        public Builder message(String message) {
485                this.message = message;
486                return this;
487        }
488
489        @Override
490        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
491                this.messageFormatter = messageFormatter;
492                return this;
493        }
494
495        @Override
496        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
497                this.throwable = throwable;
498                return this;
499        }
500
501        @Override
502        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
503                this.keyValues = keyValues;
504                return this;
505        }
506
507        @Override
508        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
509                var list = this.args;
510                if (list == null) {
511                        list = this.args = new ArrayList<>();
512                }
513                list.add(arg);
514                return this;
515        }
516
517        @Override
518        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
519                return arg(argSupplier.get());
520        }
521
522        @Override
523        public boolean log() {
524                var event = eventOrNull();
525                logger.log(event);
526                return true;
527        }
528
529        @Override
530        public LogEvent eventOrNull() {
531                @Nullable
532                List<@Nullable Object> args = this.args;
533                if (args == null) {
534                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
535                                        throwable);
536                }
537                int size = args.size();
538                return switch (size) {
539                        case 0 ->
540                                new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable);
541                        case 1 -> new OneArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
542                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0));
543                        case 2 -> new TwoArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
544                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0), args.get(1));
545                        default -> new ArrayArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
546                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.toArray());
547                };
548        }
549
550}
551
552enum NoOpLogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
553
554        NOOP;
555
556        @Override
557        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
558                return this;
559        }
560
561        @Override
562        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
563                return this;
564        }
565
566        @Override
567        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
568                return this;
569        }
570
571        @Override
572        public Builder message(String message) {
573                return this;
574        }
575
576        @Override
577        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
578                return this;
579        }
580
581        @Override
582        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
583                return this;
584        }
585
586        @Override
587        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
588                return this;
589        }
590
591        @Override
592        public boolean log() {
593                return false;
594        }
595
596        @Override
597        public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull() {
598                return null;
599        }
600
601        @Override
602        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
603                return this;
604        }
605
606        @Override
607        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
608                return this;
609        }
610
611}
612
613enum EmptyLogEvent implements LogEvent {
614
615        INFO() {
616                public Level level() {
617                        return Level.INFO;
618                }
619        },
620        DEBUG() {
621                public Level level() {
622                        return Level.DEBUG;
623                }
624        };
625
626        @Override
627        public Instant timestamp() {
628                return Instant.EPOCH;
629        }
630
631        @Override
632        public String threadName() {
633                return "";
634        }
635
636        @Override
637        public long threadId() {
638                return 0;
639        }
640
641        @Override
642        public String loggerName() {
643                return "";
644        }
645
646        @Override
647        public String message() {
648                return "";
649        }
650
651        @Override
652        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
653
654        }
655
656        @Override
657        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull() {
658                return null;
659        }
660
661        @Override
662        public KeyValues keyValues() {
663                return KeyValues.of();
664        }
665
666        public int argCount() {
667                return 0;
668        }
669
670        @Override
671        public LogEvent freeze() {
672                return this;
673        }
674
675        @Override
676        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
677                return this;
678        }
679
680}
681
682record OneArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
683                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
684                @Nullable Object arg1) implements LogEvent {
685
686        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
687                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1);
688        }
689
690        public int argCount() {
691                return 1;
692        }
693
694        public LogEvent freeze() {
695                return freeze(timestamp);
696        }
697
698        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
699                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
700                formattedMessage(sb);
701                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
702                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
703        }
704
705}
706
707record TwoArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
708                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
709                @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) implements LogEvent {
710
711        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
712                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1, arg2);
713        }
714
715        public int argCount() {
716                return 2;
717        }
718
719        public LogEvent freeze() {
720                return freeze(timestamp);
721        }
722
723        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
724                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
725                formattedMessage(sb);
726                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
727                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
728        }
729}
730
731record ArrayArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
732                String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter,
733                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull, @Nullable Object[] args) implements LogEvent {
734
735        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
736                messageFormatter.formatArray(sb, message, args);
737        }
738
739        public int argCount() {
740                return args.length;
741        }
742
743        public LogEvent freeze() {
744                return freeze(timestamp);
745        }
746
747        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
748                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
749                formattedMessage(sb);
750                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
751                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
752        }
753
754}
755
756record DefaultLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
757                String loggerName, String formattedMessage, KeyValues keyValues,
758                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull) implements LogEvent {
759
760        public int argCount() {
761                return 0;
762        }
763
764        public KeyValues getKeyValues() {
765                return keyValues;
766        }
767
768        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
769                sb.append(this.formattedMessage);
770        }
771
772        public String message() {
773                return this.formattedMessage;
774        }
775
776        public LogEvent freeze() {
777                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
778                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, mkvs,
779                                        throwableOrNull);
780                }
781                return this;
782        }
783
784        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
785                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
786                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, mkvs,
787                                        throwableOrNull);
788                }
789                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
790                                throwableOrNull);
791        }
792
793}
794
795record StackFrameLogEvent(LogEvent event, CallerInfo callerOrNull) implements LogEvent {
796
797        @Override
798        public Instant timestamp() {
799                return event.timestamp();
800        }
801
802        @Override
803        public String threadName() {
804                return event.threadName();
805        }
806
807        @Override
808        public long threadId() {
809                return event.threadId();
810        }
811
812        @Override
813        public Level level() {
814                return event.level();
815        }
816
817        @Override
818        public String loggerName() {
819                return event.loggerName();
820        }
821
822        @Override
823        public String message() {
824                return event.message();
825        }
826
827        @Override
828        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
829                event.formattedMessage(sb);
830
831        }
832
833        @Override
834        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull() {
835                return event.throwableOrNull();
836        }
837
838        @Override
839        public KeyValues keyValues() {
840                return event.keyValues();
841        }
842
843        @Override
844        public LogEvent freeze() {
845                var e = event.freeze();
846                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
847                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
848                        return this;
849                }
850
851                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
852        }
853
854        @Override
855        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
856                var e = event.freeze(timestamp);
857                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
858                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
859                        return this;
860                }
861                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
862        }
863
864}
